title: Georgia Fowler looks effortlessly chic in a black jumpsuit as she arrives at an event in New York
text:
She never fails to put her best fashion foot forward.

And on Thursday, Georgia Fowler, 27, looked effortlessly chic as she arrived at the Noble Panacea Launch in at New York's Metropolitan Museum.

The rainy evening didn't stop the Auckland-born stunner from flaunting her stylish ensemble on the famous steps.

Babe in black! Georgia Fowler looked effortlessly chic as she arrived at the Noble Panacea Launch in at New York's Metropolitan Museum on Thursday

The brunette beauty went braless in a black jumpsuit that hugged her statuesque figure and featured a plunging neckline.

Her look was teamed with a gold earrings, a small black purse and a pair of Manolo Blahnik ruby heels with a bejewelled buckle across the toes.

For makeup, she matched her shoes to her lips, with a bold red on her pout for a pop of colour, along with feathered brows and mascara.

Hot: The brunette beauty went braless in a black jumpsuit that hugged her statuesque figure and featured a plunging neckline

Her elegant look comes after she recently spoke her 'classic' personal style with Vogue Australia.

'I like to think my style is easy going, classic and adaptable. I'm not big on trends and though I love a few standout pieces a season, I tend to buy fashion that can be worn many ways (thus easy to travel with) and can stand the test of time,' she explained.

She also recently shared her support calling for diversity on the runway after Australian model Robyn Lawley urged people to boycott Victoria's Secret if they don't use a 'curvy girl' in the next show.

Chic: Her look was teamed with a gold earrings, a small black purse and a pair of Manolo Blahnik ruby heels with a bejewelled buckle across the toes

Speaking to The Daily Telegraph last week, Kiwi model Georgia said: 'there should be diversity because beauty comes in all forms'.

'I mean I've done it for the past three years and it was always a dream growing up to be a part of it and it's disappointing it's not going to happen this year - but who knows what will happen,' she told the publication.

The brunette beauty walked the runway for the brand from 2016 to 2018.
description: She never fails to put her best fashion foot forward.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
